block.p: TELERGY INC., -- Dewitt, N.Y., which is building a high-capacity network of optical fiber throughout the Northeast, reached a $20 million deal to help El Paso Energy Corp. begin a national telecommunications business.

ST. JOE CO., -- Jacksonville, Fla., one of Florida's largest landowners, agreed to sell 15,105 acres of land in southwest Georgia known as the Chickasawhatchee Swamp to the Nature Conservancy, a nonprofit organization, for $30 million.

TELERGY INC., -- Dewitt, N.Y., which is building a high-capacity network of optical fiber throughout the Northeast, reached a $20 million deal to help El Paso Energy Corp. begin a national telecommunications business.

ST. JOE CO., -- Jacksonville, Fla., one of Florida's largest landowners, agreed to sell 15,105 acres of land in southwest Georgia known as the Chickasawhatchee Swamp to the Nature Conservancy, a nonprofit organization, for $30 million.
TARGUS GROUP INTERNATIONAL INC., -- New Haven, a maker of notebook computer carrying cases, acquired the closely held Wickford Backpack Co., West Warwick, R.I. Terms were not disclosed.
UNISYS CORP., -- Blue Bell, Pa., a computer services company, agreed to manage the check processing operations of Barclays Bank and Lloyds/TSB Group P.L.C. of Britain.
